posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>83542292
Accolades from NEETs and other larpers on HN.
I use PostgreSQL for personal projects but the advantages over MySQL is so minimal that they're practically insignificant these days. Facebook has been using MySQL since the beginning. Uber actually switched from Postgres to MySQL and wrote a detailed debrief explaining why.
Both are great.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Those of you who think iOS is genuinely a better mobile operating system than Android, why?

>inb4andjeet
I am, but I want to have an open minded discussion about this. Android has always struck me as the more "powerful" OS. Nearly everything down to the keyboard can be customized and adjusted for your needs.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>83542143
>saying anything good about Apple products makes you an apple shill
Fuck off nigger brained retarded

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>83541098
I switched from Android to iOS earlier this year because I got tired of shit just not working. I decided to dip my toe in and get a 2020 SE and I continue to be amused with how smoothly everything runs.
Yes, iOS is quite caged, you can't install applications from outside the app store and I'm pretty sure the most adventurous modification you could make to your phone's software is using a new keyboard or something, but otherwise iOS is a dream to use on a day-to-day basis. There are thousands of little quality of life improvements that iOS has over Android that make the experience feel a lot smoother and more reliable, and I think I'm starting to value that more than the freedom to tinker.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
From a technical perspective, Android used to be objectively worse in many aspects (e.g. security) but in the past couple of years has pulled ahead of iOS. I honestly prefer Android's openness and customizability. But I still use iOS for my daily work because Android is saddled by the bullshit OEMs pull every time they release a product, whether it's Google cheaping out on the SoC (Pixel 5) or cutting corners with QA, or Samsung putting an infuriatingly slow and finicky fingerprint reader on the S20 series or stuffing One UI with ads, or any number of other sins.
iPhone may not be the best but it's a solid 8 across the board and as a tool it's great.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Users of all levels are welcome to ask questions about Windows and share their experiences.
Tell us about tools, utilities, configs, tips & tricks that enhance your life with Windows (ReactOS users are also welcome).

Remember: notice the friendly - please be civil when possible.

>Choosing, downloading, installing, activating windows/office, useful resources & recommended software infograph (/fwt/ paste)
https://rentry.co/fwt
https://rentry.co/fwtdwnl

>Installing Windows, for retards
https://rentry.co/windows_for_retards

FAQ:
>Which version should I get?
>Where can I get the ISOs?
>What the fuck is an .svf file?
>What does LTSC 2019 have?
>How do I verify the ISOs aren't fake/infected?
>How do I activate Windows?
>How do I change to a different edition post-install?
>How do I disable backported telemetry in 8.1/7?
>What software do you recommend/should I install?
See paste. (your other unmentioned question is probably here, too)

>How do I debloat/debotnet Windows 10 1803-2004?
Offline (pre-installation): Optimize-Offline
Guide: https://rentry.co/mdl-optimize-guide
Online (live installation): privacy.sexy / wpd.app / W10Privacy / privatezilla
Don't mix offline & online tools with each other.

>Do I really need to debloat it?
If you had to ask, then no.

>Can you get the Ryzen scheduler on LTSC 2019?
No. Wait for LTSC 2022, or use SAC (semi-annual channel) editions.

>Can I upgrade to LTSC 2019?
Only from a previous LTSC build(s) w/o doing the upgradematrix hack in paste.

>Is Windows 10 2004/20H2 OK?
Only Education & Enterprise.

>I already run Windows 7, but don't want to clean install?
The non-LTSC installers can upgrade.

>Are homebrew ISOs safe to use (Gen2/Ameliorated)?
Depending on trust&rep, almost never. Most of the time these are unverifiable and unreproducible.

/fwt/ spammer aka staxshill filter (4chanX): https://pastebin.com/F0Trfkfq
